lines.text: A study at Harvard determined a person's longevity by the first thing they read in the paper.
I'm an obituary man.
Start with the comics, you'll live longer.
This looks... um... handled.
You expect me to violate everything I was ever taught? I have duties.
Yeah, and your duties can send an innocent man to jail for the rest of his life. You wanna live with that.
Yeah, and I think you better leave.
This is Carla's tape from her answering machine
Yeah.
Well, how'd you get it?
I stole it.
I think the president's gonna become an international suspect.
Jesus, Alvin. You really had her killed, didn't you? She was 25. She was a child!
She was a casualty of war!

[On seeing a livid Neil hit Alvin]
Mr... President!
"If I must choose between righteousness and peace, I choose righteousness."
You were born to become a chalk outline.
[after a White House camera picture ends up on a tabloid front page]

[to his staff]
Whoever leaked this, I'm going to *bottle his last breath*!
Do you what it means to be a team player?
Sharp-shooting isn't a team sport.
You have the right to an attorney. If you can't afford one, *you prick, one will be appointed by the court.
It's a nasty-ass city, Regis.
